pros: Friendly environment fair opportunity and good salaries relatively
Multinational and multicultural work environment, opportunity to live in countries another way you will never visit. Comfortable installations, good work environment. Equilibrated work/rest balance.
cons: Working in a very complex context. Corruption fight is a major challenge at all levels. Management support is poor. The institution is weak and stakeholders and contracts try to take control of the projects.

pros: a good start to work with

pros: Humanitarian mandate, making a difference for the lives of people affected by conflict and other situations of violence, well-established structure and way of operating across contexts, additional benefits on hardship missions, many opportunities within the organization to be exposed to a variety of programmes and activities, as well as opportunities for career mobility within and across departments.
cons: Heavy organizational structure, bureaucracy, too many institutional changes, revised salary scheme that bring disincentives to staying long-term, having to apply through the 'Compendium' process for next missions that disregards years of service to the ICRC.

pros: International, Diverse, challenging, nice people, experience
cons: Not much room to move up

job_title: Data and Analytics Staff in Baghdad
pros: Nice environment and a good place to strength your CV
cons: Salary is not that much and there is no way to improve yourself.

pros: Positive working environment and a great opportunity to work in the humanitarian field, help people and support a cause
cons: Difficult or no promotion is the main challenge for many employees

job_title: Tracing Field Officer/Grade IV in Baghdad
pros: It was the best thing that happened to me....the friendships that I've made are timeless...I haven't seen such team spirit as the one among my colleagues, we were just like one soul...everyone is watching for the other...the experience acquired is very unique taking into consideration the particularity of the country that we worked in, and the surrounding circumstances.
cons: Media coverage has always been poor...and it should be repetitive and not just for a certain period of time.

pros: Clean offices, nice colleagues, water and coffee are always available, 1 hour daily lunch break.
cons: No matter how hard you work, your work goes unnoticed and unappreciated, grading system is not fair, salaries are little compared to the amount of effort we put into our work, break time is not respected, daily and endless interruptions, HR and management do not respond to complaints, working environment is tense.

job_title: Human Resources Manager Assistant Executive Director Human Resources Generalist in Baghdad
pros: Multicultural people coming from around the glob
cons: very demotivated work place no limited opportunity to advance the career ladder, very boxed environment where you cannot use any creativity and your efforts unappreciated
